description: Dive into "Romantic Escapes in The Hague" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Romantic Escapes in The Hague

places.generalDescription: De Pier in Den Haag, also known as Scheveningen Pier, is a popular recreational spot with both enclosed and open-air decks. It offers a variety of casual restaurants and thrilling activities like bungee jumping. The pier provides an enjoyable experience for visitors, combining leisurely strolls with attractions and dining options. Situated on the Scheveningen boulevard, it serves as a charming location to relax while enjoying scenic views of the North Sea.
places.name: De Pier. La Haya

reviews.text: Amazing spot to visit. The pier itself has a massive selection of stuff to eat and do ranging from trampoline park to bungee jumping over the water. We rode the Ferris wheel and it was definitely worth the price - great views and nice long ride. Also the entire area around the pier is lively and vibrant with many vendors and people to see. This area is a must visit when in the area!

Great area to wander around, enjoy some people-watching and refresh in the sea. The beach is (oder course) very crowded. All around De Pier are a lot of souvenir shops, restaurants, bars and ice cream shops, so no one has to leave thirsty or hungry. The Big Wheel is a highlight, enjoy watching it while having a drink in De Pier own bars inside (very warm!) or from the top of De Pier. Courageous people can also do the Bungee Jump or the zip line.

‚≠ê De Pier ‚Äì A must-visit by the sea!

Absolutely loved my time at De Pier! üåä
Beautiful views of the North Sea, cool ocean breeze, and a lively boardwalk full of food, drinks, and fun activities. Whether you're looking to relax, take amazing photos, or just enjoy a nice walk over the water ‚Äì this place is perfect.

Bonus: there's even a bungee jump and Ferris wheel for thrill-seekers! üé°
Great spot to spend an afternoon ‚Äì highly recommended!

places.generalDescription: Madurodam is an interactive park featuring miniature models of Dutch buildings, landmarks, and daily life. The park showcases famous attractions such as the Binnenhof/Parliament, Peace Palace, and Noordeinde Palace in a 1:25 scale setting. Visitors can explore replicas of windmills, markets, museums, and even witness a harbor fire being extinguished. With pathways and tram tracks creating a sprawling village atmosphere, Madurodam offers an immersive experience for all ages.

sources.snippet: Discover world famous miniatures, all kind of fun (water) games and attractions in which a small country seems big. In Madurodam there is a lot to see and especially a lot to do together with the whole family. You will need to have eyes in the back of your head to be able to take it all in.
sources.shortName: Instagrammable hotspots in the Hague

sources.snippet: Wouldn‚Äôt it be nice if you could travel across the Netherlands as a couple?. Well, you can‚Äôt do that in one date.
sources.shortName: Romantic Things to do in Amsterdam, Rotterdam and The Hague
Things to do in The Hague : Museums and attractions

places.name: Madurodam

reviews.text: Loved it, what a wonderful piece of art, that Is amazing, every zone has its own beauty, moreover nothing is less but plane ‚úàÔ∏è experience inside it is out standing, a must go place to bring you child here. There is also a shall canteen to have some light snacks and a souvenir shop is also there to bring some gifts. Overall a wonderful experience, but remember you must spare enough time to go there because it needs almost half day to complete it properly if you are a detail lover.

Madurodam was my favorite experience during my entire trip to the Netherlands. I loved exploring the miniature versions of Dutch cities and landmarks. It felt like traveling through the whole country in just a few hours. My favorite parts were steering the ships through the canals, controlling the helicopter, and interacting with the fun exhibits like attracting the fishes.

The park is very well designed, with so many details that bring Dutch history, architecture, and culture to life. It's both educational and entertaining, making it a great place for families, couples, or solo travelers. I would recommend it as one of the first stops for tourists visiting the Netherlands.

The staff were very friendly and welcoming, which made the experience even better. Parking was a little pricey, but that might just be my perspective as a visitor from abroad. Overall, I would definitely like to return and see it again.

A charming miniature park that's great for families with kids.

This is a large-scale miniature theme park. While the entrance fee is on the higher side, the overall atmosphere and maintenance are quite good. The park area isn't very big, but it's packed with detailed and well-made exhibits.

Our child especially enjoyed the small interactive games scattered throughout the park. One highlight was the movie journey inside a real airplane - a creative touch that shows the thoughtfulness behind the park's design.

The children's playground was also a hit, offering a fun space for kids to burn off some energy.

Overall, we highly recommend this park for families with children. It's an enjoyable and well-kept attraction that's definitely worth a visit.

places.address: George Maduroplein 1, 2584 RZ Den Haag, Netherlands

places.generalDescription: Museum Voorlinden is a private museum located in Wassenaar, near The Hague, showcasing a remarkable collection of modern and contemporary art. Opened in 2016, the museum was inaugurated by King William-Alexander and features the renowned Caldic Collection, assembled by businessman and art collector Joop van Caldenborgh. The striking white building houses a rich and surprising collection, including permanent works created specifically for the museum as well as temporary exhibitions.

sources.snippet: In Museum Voorlinden you will find modern and contemporary art such as James Turell, Maurizio Cattelan and Richard Serra. Some of the artworks were specially made for the museum. One of the works of art that belongs to the Highlights collection is the illusionistic Swimming Pool by the Argentinian artist Leandro Erlich and the artwork Couple under an Umbrella by Ron Mueck.
sources.shortName: Instagrammable hotspots in the Hague

sources.snippet: Complete with its own private sculpture garden, the museum and gallery has some interesting sights to see for couples. Dive into the swimming pool illusion or lie next to each other beneath a hyper-realistic umbrella. When you‚Äôve completed all the illusions and seen all the art, take a break and get to know each other even better at the museum terrace restaurant.
sources.shortName: Romantic Things to do in Amsterdam, Rotterdam and The Hague

places.name: Museum Voorlinden

reviews.text: Had a wonderful day exploring the museum with friends. There was lost of variation and the set up of the rooms is so nice and easy to navigate. It is spacious so even when crowded still does not feel full. The little book you receive at entry gives lots of background on every art piece. Some of the art would place in my house, so interesting and cool. Also enjoyed the pop-up shop and regular shop. The candy special that required a time-slot was very nice, go in line timely, but it goes quite fast. This special part required shoes off. For those that can't take off their shoes there are shoe covers. Spent around 2,5/3 hours in the museum. Also beautiful landscaping outside.

Museum VoorlinMuseum Voorlinden is a beautiful and well-curated modern art museum, worth visiting if you are in the area.

The staff is friendly and helpful, which made the experience smooth and pleasant. The artworks are all special in their own way, and each room offers something different. A standout for us was the marshmallow house - playful and unexpected, it really stood out as a highlight.

There are a few practical things to note. You are not allowed to take even a water bottle inside, so plan accordingly. Also, the toilets are located outside the main building, which means you have to walk a bit to reach them.

Overall, a unique and engaging museum experience. We give it 4 out of 5 stars.
den

The pool is very famous yes, but if u go there just for that I would say it's not worth it. But there are so much more to see. The environment surrounded is just so good to be true. Highly recommended even if just for the view outside. And the museum inside itself must be one of the most beautiful museum I have ever seen.

places.generalDescription: Van Kleef Distillery Museum, founded in 1842, is a unique and well-known spot in The Hague. It's the last jenever producer in the city and offers free visits with tastings of their local spirits. The distillery produces various types of jenever, including limited editions like the aged Old Chap. As part museum, liquor shop, and tasting center, it provides tours to showcase its distilling equipment and traditional craftsmanship.

sources.snippet: This place is the last jenever producer in The Hague, but it‚Äôs a must-visit for its local legend. The story goes that when the Dutch artist Vincent van Gogh needed a hint of inspiration, he‚Äôd go to Van Kleef.
sources.shortName: Romantic Things to do in Amsterdam, Rotterdam and The Hague

places.name: Van Kleef Distillery Museum

reviews.text:
The cocktail tastings are a definite must do here. You can experience it in both English or Dutch. 5 cocktails and many good times complete with snacks and good banter.

The tasting is done out in a garden that makes you feel like you're not in the middle of a busy city. The people working there love their jobs and were super helpful in helping us with which liqueurs to try and to possibly take home.

Take your mum here. She will definitely have a great day out.

This was an unexpected gem for our day trip to The Hague, we were expecting a museum but found a delightful bar in an authentic setting. The staff are incredibly helpful (and funny), the food is very good but the star of the experience is the drinks. We indulged in several flights and fully expect to be back soon. If you're coming to the city center you must come and enjoy this place.

We went back again this year and the experience was as equally enjoyable as the first, except we were able to sit outside this time in the garden and it was an even more delightful experience.

A lovely former brewery that still bottles jenever. The facility has an amazing garden!
The host do an amazing story about the history of Jenever, the difference between old and new Jenever, the difference between jenever and gin and why it isn't allowed to brew in the city...

places.address: Lange Beestenmarkt 109, 2512 ED Den Haag, Netherlands

places.generalDescription: Noordeinde Palace, a historic site dating back to the 16th century, serves as the Dutch king's offices and is not open for public tours.

sources.snippet: Noordeinde Palace, with its gracefully landscaped garden, is located at the Noordeinde, one of the most elegant shopping streets in The Hague. Noordeinde Palace has been the centre of important events in the life of the royal family and the well-known scene which takes place from off the balcony on Prince's Day (opening of the parliamentary year) every third Tuesday of September. Tip: take a beautiful selfie in the Palace Garden, which is accessible for free.
sources.shortName: Instagrammable hotspots in the Hague

sources.snippet: Be enchanted by the regal elegance and romantic grandeur of Noordeinde Palace, the official royal residence of the Dutch king, where couples can admire the majestic architecture, bask in the royal charm, and revel in the rich history that surrounds this stately palace, igniting feelings of romance and awe as they embark on a captivating journey through the city's royal heritage.
sources.shortName: A Romantic Stroll through Dutch Splendor ‚Äì Opatrip

places.name: Noordeinde Palace

reviews.text:
Oh wow that was amazing, I wanted to visit that place just because it came to my mind to visit a royal palace and I got lucky because then figured out that it was opened just for two weeks in the year.

The atmosphere inside is magnificent and I felt soo lucky to be there. There was even audio guides which I did not expect. The only rule that you need to hang it on your neck posed me offüòÑ because I don't like to hang something on the neck and feel uncomfortable.

Also mind that you can't take videos and of course touch anything. But photos were amazing, I wanted to match the place as also few (unfortunately) people. Because I am maybe very visual so people on the sneakers and shorts was breaking the feeling that you are somewhere in the classy place and brought you back to relity.
The day i went i was lucky that there was an ceremony for two new ambassador so i had  experienced the march and horse carriage around the palace.

Definitely worth a visit if you have the opportunity, because it's rare to see a palace that is in actual use. Only accessible for a few weeks per year, though, and with limited availability of tickets.

places.generalDescription: "Escher in the Palace" is a permanent exhibition located in the former royal winter palace on Lange Voorhout in The Hague. This grand building now showcases the graphic artworks of M.C. Escher, a renowned Dutch artist known for his precise and bewildering works. The exhibition features a comprehensive collection of Escher's woodcuts, lithographs, and other pieces from various stages of his career, offering insight into his unique blending of different perspectives and mathematical rules with artistic subject matter.

sources.snippet: Lange Voorhout is one of the most romantic streets in The Hague. One place you shouldn‚Äôt miss here is the art gallery of Escher in Het Paleis, where the Queen Mother Emma stayed in the winter until 1934. It doesn‚Äôt get more royal than this.
sources.shortName: Romantic Things to do in Amsterdam, Rotterdam and The Hague

places.name: Escher in the Palace

reviews.text:
I absolutely loved this museum. I was aware of some of Escher's work, but nothing prepared me for the number and scope of his work. A lot of people know about the prints that play with perspective, angles, and your perceptions, but I loved the landscapes as well. It's a totally engrossing couple of hours.
Museums that are dedicated to one artist are great because you learn more about the artists life and development.
Reminded me of the Van Gogh museum in Amsterdam.
Well worth going to.

Incredible! The palace in of itself is brilliant, but the history, life and works of M. C. Escher is just awe inspiring. I loved every moment of my few hours (yes that's all you need here). I really took my time walking around, reading pretty much everything. There's a  summary as you enter each room/ gallery. I was really impressed by floor 3. Modern pieces that interpret the mind bending greatness of Eschers works, so do go up to the top floor.
My biggest takeaway was how massively inspired/influenced/ motivated Escher was by the Islamic art and architecture of South Spain/ Andalucia. In the narrative there was more emphasis on his time in Italy and the wonderful landscapes there, but in my opinion Andalucia changed something in him towards the magnificent work we all really know him for, tessalations, metamorphosis, patterns, perspective etc. A memorable visit!

Loved this musuem. It was sorry of a two for the price of one as it was housed in a formal royal palace of Emma, the Queen Mother, mother to Queen Wilhelmina. Most of Escher's famous works were on display.  Left the museum appreciating the genius that Escher was.  Also has a cafe but didn't access it.

places.address: Lange Voorhout 74, 2514 EH Den Haag, Netherlands

places.generalDescription: Nestled within the expansive Clingendael estate in The Hague, the Japanese Garden is a serene and captivating oasis that reflects the deep admiration of Baroness van Brienen for Japanese culture. This enchanting garden, which opens for just a few weeks each year to preserve its exquisite nature, showcases a curated collection of rare plants, Buddha statues, stone lanterns, and charming bridges over lotus-filled ponds.
places.name: Japanese Garden

reviews.text: A very small but beautiful Japanese garden. I went on a Wednesday and it wasn't too crowded. Not worth a long trip on its own, but perfect for a relaxed half-day activity. There is also a nice cafe in the park for a coffee break after

Takes max to max 10 mins to explore this park. Centrally located in amazing Landgoed Clingendael.
Park is small and cute, very colourful, and nice to taking pictures, instragramable location üòÄ

Free to visit, and very well maintained!

It's next to a caf√©, can't do picnic inside this garden, but outside there is lot of nice green grass patches...

This park might not be suitable for people with mobility issues.

Went at around 530pm-6pm and was not crowded. Nice vibe and surrounded by relaxing park. Hard to get to the place though if you don't have a car.

Took 10mins to explore. Probably good to visit for photoshoots.

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the elegant quarter of The Hague, Hotel Des Indes is a historic boutique hotel that has been offering luxury accommodations for over 130 years. Surrounded by landmarks linked to the Dutch royal family, such as Noordeinde Palace and Escher in Het Paleis, this exclusive establishment exudes timeless charm. Despite its classic early 20th-century appearance, the hotel provides modern amenities for a comfortable stay.

sources.snippet: Hotel Des Indes might just be the grandest hotel in the Netherlands, and it‚Äôs certainly the most exclusive entry in this article. If you ever want to treat your loved one to something special in The Hague, this is your go-to spot. You won‚Äôt be surprised that this is a hotspot for the diplomatic community and has seen quite its share of heads of state visiting.
sources.shortName: Places to eat in The Hague: 7 trendy restaurants to visit in 2025

sources.snippet: Formerly a city palace, this property has always been a luxurious abode. Located in the heart town it is perfect for exploring by foot. Its 92 rooms range from small to palatial and all are tastefully decorated.
sources.shortName: Best places to stay in The Hague, The Netherlands (2025)

places.name: Hotel Des Indes

reviews.text: I had dinner in the restaurant. The staff are friendly, highly attentive and very professional. No request is too much. Thoroughly enjoyed the spring rolls and the ravioli. The desserts were a little sweet for me but they were very beautiful. Coffee was very good.

An institution in The Hague. Truly exceptional. The entire hotel is just gorgeous ‚Äì old, but so well maintained and preserved.

Staff is excellent. Breakfast, lunch, high-tea, dinner ‚Äì it's all excellent. Rooms are carefully decorated and stylish, which is even more impressive given the old style.

If you have the chance, definitely check it out.

The yellow hotel is our absolute favorite. We are from The Hague and booked this place to start our half a year travel around the world. And it was fantastic, from the massages, the doorman to the amazing breakfast. If you want to be recognised and taken care off, this is your place!

places.address: Lange Voorhout 54-56, 2514 EG Den Haag, Netherlands

places.generalDescription: Located in The Hague, Family park Drievliet is a popular destination for families seeking a day of thrilling rides and delightful attractions. From heart-pounding roller coasters to gentle rides suitable for young children, the park offers a wide range of entertainment options. In addition to the exciting rides, visitors can also enjoy entertaining shows such as the Jungle Show and pirate spectacle at the Parktheater.

sources.snippet: Drievliet has all kinds of rides - everything from a giant spinning octopus wheel to a mining-theme ride. Drievliet only has a couple of rides that are more for thrill seekers - this park is more family oriented and is a good pick for an easy going date. If you want an even more romantic atmosphere, travel to the fairy-tale themed theme park of Efteling about an hour and a half away from The Hague.
sources.shortName: Romantic Things to do in Amsterdam, Rotterdam and The Hague

sources.snippet: Not everyone knows that there are several amusement parks in the Hague!. Consider heading to Drievliet, which is marketed as a family park. However, you can enjoy a fun day riding the roller coasters, eating cotton candy, and otherwise having that dream date straight out of the movies.
sources.shortName: 20 Fun & easy date ideas for the Hague from a local

places.name: Family park Drievliet

reviews.text: A very nice family friendly park with attraction for all ages. As soon as your kid is 100 cm it can try almost all attractions together with a grown-up. Just a very few are from 140 cm on. Great park to visit with children in different ages.

Overall, we had an enjoyable day. I visited with my 3-year-old son (under 1 meter tall), and there were enough attractions suitable for his age group. The park is well thought out for small children.

A few practical notes: The lockers weren't working, and the park is quite large. If you're coming with extra belongings, I recommend bringing something to help you carry them easily, a stroller can be very helpful, even if you think your child won't need it much.

The women's toilets near the restaurant area were insufficient; it's better to use the ones in other parts of the park.

I suggest arriving early in the morning and starting from the far end of the park, going against the general flow. That way, you'll avoid long queues at the first attractions.

Drievliet is a fun and well-organized amusement park, especially ideal for families with children. While I personally enjoyed the visit, most of the rides and attractions are clearly designed with younger kids in mind. It's a great place for a relaxed day out, but adults seeking thrill rides might find the options limited. That said, there are still a few exciting rides for older visitors, like the fast roller coaster Formule X, the wild mouse-style ride Kopermijn, the spinning coaster Twistrix, and the powered coaster Dynamite Express. Additionally, adults can enjoy rides like Nautilus, a swinging and spinning attraction, and Draaikolk, a fast-turning ride. As a whole, it's a highly recommended destination for families with kids.

places.address: Laan van 's-Gravenmade, 2495 BD Den Haag, Netherlands

places.name: KITESURFSPOT

reviews.text:
Amazing Kiteboarding Experience at Kitesurfspot!

I had the best time learning to kitesurf at Kitesurfspot! The instructors are incredibly professional and put safety first at all times, which made me feel confident and secure throughout the lessons. They really take their time to teach you at your own pace, making sure you understand everything you need to know to become an independent kitesurfer.

On top of that, the vibe is just fantastic! The team creates a fun, relaxed atmosphere that makes every session enjoyable. Whether you're a beginner or looking to improve your skills, I can't recommend Kitesurfspot enough. If you want top-quality instruction with an awesome group of people, this is the place to go!
Such cool school with nice and friendly instructors! I'm enjoying the lessons even in this cold weather!

I had the best experience! Samuel was my teacher and I waited especially for him to come back from Peru to teach me again after half a year. He is really dedicated to make the best out of each lesson and truely has trust in his students. Nothing but good words especially because of his enthusiasm; he makes kitesurfing fun!

places.address: Zuiderstrand 19, Strandslag 2, 2555 ZZ, 2554 ZZ Den Haag, Netherlands

places.generalDescription: This beachfront restaurant serves up amazing Cuban-inspired cuisine, complete with fresh fruit juices and delicious coffees. The pavilion is located directly on the beach, making it the perfect spot for a relaxing morning or afternoon browsing the sand and sea.

sources.snippet: We went to Suiderstrand for dinner, (5-minute walk from the house) on our first day in The Hague, at sunset. We were still pretty amazed by the beautiful beach house and so having the chance to dine in such a beautiful setting only added to the magic, we were pretty lucky!. We were warmly greeted by Sander, a handsome young smiling man.
sources.shortName: Romantic getaway in The Hague

places.name: Habana Beach

reviews.text:
Such an amazing beach bar, I absolutely love this place, the best beach bar I've ever been to, it is like the treasure of Kijkduin beach.
A very friendly service, and such excellent food and drinks, simply the best. I can't wait until I can visit again.

Beautiful getaway with a mesmerizing view. Sea food platter was lekker. Beautifully served and tasted just so good, unlike a fried sea food that you find in any Dutch restaurant.
Be aware of the surroundings you might feel like you are somewhere in Morocco (tangier) and not west coast of Netherlands.
Friendly staff, delicious food and cold drinks.

places.address: Strand Zuid 15, 2554 ZZ Den Haag, Netherlands

places.generalDescription: Het Plein, located in the heart of The Hague, is a bustling square popular among Dutch students and adults for unwinding after a long day. With its festive lights, outdoor seating, and heaters during winter, it offers a cozy atmosphere known as 'gezellig.' The square is surrounded by historic buildings and trees, making it an ideal spot for al fresco dining.

sources.snippet: Delight in the lively energy and romantic charm of Het Plein, a bustling square adorned with charming cafes and restaurants, providing couples with an idyllic setting to savor delectable cuisines, enjoy intimate conversations, and bask in the vibrant ambiance that fosters an atmosphere of love and togetherness.
sources.shortName: A Romantic Stroll through Dutch Splendor ‚Äì Opatrip

places.name: Het Plein

reviews.text: Another place in The Hague that is worth visiting to feel the Dutch atmosphere. The statue of William the Silent, the national hero of the Netherlands, will remind you of where you are. Pleasantly, quietly and without crowds during our evening walk. Worth a visit.

Honestly, it's not as interesting as you might expect.
It's just a fairly open square with a few statues and buildings around, but nothing that really grabs your attention.
There's a lot of empty space, and unless there's an event going on, it feels a bit plain and quiet.
If you're already passing by, it's fine to take a short look, but I wouldn't make a special trip just for this place.
The nicest place I found in den Haag, a quiet square full of comfortable large cafes so fitting the great hero Wilhelm the Silent, the father of the Netherlands.

places.generalDescription: Museum Prinsenhof Delft, once a convent of St. Agatha, holds great historical significance as the former residence of Prince William the Silent, a key figure in the creation of the Dutch Republic. The museum showcases 17th-century arts and crafts alongside exhibits on William's role in the Spanish Revolt. The tragic event that took place here, where William was assassinated by Balthasar Gerard in 1584, is commemorated throughout the museum.

sources.snippet: Museum Prinsenhof Delft was the scene of one of the most important events in Dutch history: the assassination of King William of Orange. On 10 July 1584, he was gunned down by Balthasar Gerards as he climbed the stairs to his office. You can still see the bullet holes in the wall of the museum today.
sources.shortName: Top 20 things to do

places.name: Museum Prinsenhof Delft

reviews.text:
A nice museum. I went to learn about dutch history but also got to see some local art.
What really made my visit special was seeing Theo Jansen's Strandbeest out in the yard - I saw it online many times and it was fascinating seeing it up close.

Very informative museum with a ton of masterpieces from the 17th century. They were telling the story of life and death of William the silent the father of dutch nation and great ancestor of the current king. I really liked the complex personality and liberal nature of his actions. The museum has perfectly utilized all mediums available to make a great experience with very detailed explanations on pieces of propaganda and really brilliantly set the context for the story. Do recommend totally worth it üëå.

The museum Prinsenhof is a fun visit mainly for the imprints the events here have left on Dutch History. Its interesting to see a part of history come to life on the famous stairs. The exposition on the uprising are interesting with some beautiful paintings, but not very expansive. Many more stories could be told if the museum wanted. Especially if they did away with the completely random exhibition on some artist the name of whom I have already forgotten.

places.generalDescription: The Boutique Hotel De Salon is located in the heart of Amsterdam, close to the Royal Palace. It offers 4 bedrooms with a dressing area, as well as a patio, pretty garden and games to pass the time. There are dining choices within walking distance including Lola Bike & Coffee and Restaurant Mazie.

sources.snippet: This boutique hotel in The Hague offers a blend of historic charm and modern comfort. Its whimsical decor adds a quirky touch to its elegant ambiance. Enjoy a continental breakfast, and take advantage of nearby attractions like the Mauritshuis and canal tours.
sources.shortName: Best places to stay in The Hague, The Netherlands (2025)

places.name: Boutique Hotel De Salon van Fagel

reviews.text:
One of the best hotels we've stayed in while visiting the Netherlands!

The location is excellent-right in the heart of the city with loads of cafes and restaurants within walking distance. We stayed in a the Loft Room, which was spacious, beautifully clean, and had a great bath. The bed was super comfortable, and even though the hotel is on a busy high street, the room was completely quiet.

What really made our stay exceptional was the staff. They were incredibly helpful-carried our bags to the room and gave us great tips for exploring the city and dinner. Nothing was too much trouble.

We'll definitely be returning!

Fabulous location, super friendly & helpful staff. Stairs to the upstairs suites were STEEP!  But hotel staff happy to help with bags - just be aware they're not around 24/7 to check you in. So if you're a late arrival, you'll be lugging those bags up the stairs yourself! Plenty of ground floor rooms though so there are options - just ask when booking. You might get a bit of noise from the pub next door. But they do good meals too. We loved our stay here, was very hard to leave.

Very nice, clean hotel with surprisingly spacious rooms. It's in an ideal location, as you are close to everything. Note that reception is not attended 24/7, but the staff is very friendly and made the self check-in easy, following up to make sure everything is going well. The hand-written welcome card was an especially nice touch.

places.generalDescription: The Hotel Indigo the Hague - Palace Noordeinde has views of Noordeinde Palace, is a modern hotel with retro-inspired decoration, and is within walking distance of attractions in the heart of Noordeinde. The front desk staff is friendly and efficient, breakfast is OK, and the design of the rooms is very special. I would recommend this hotel.

sources.snippet: A chic boutique hotel in a former bank just steps from the Royal Palace Noordeinde in The Hague. The vibrant Art Deco interiors boast luxurious touches - think oak panelling and spa-inspired bathrooms. Gourmet dining and drinks at the speakeasy-style Gold Bar complete a sophisticated picture.
sources.shortName: Best places to stay in The Hague, The Netherlands (2025)

places.name: Hotel Indigo the Hague - Palace Noordeinde, an IHG Hotel

reviews.text:
The location is the best part. I walked literally everywhere! It's an absolutely beautiful neighborhood and great for shopping. You have to pay if you want a decent view from your room so my view was of an alley. The bathroom was beautiful.

They have umbrella rentals available for a price.

I had a drink coupon and went down to the restaurant one night to find it was closed (I think it still said it was open online). The one staff member in the lobby was so sweet and kindly gave me a drink from the bar anyway. I really appreciated that.

I would stay here again.

The staff is amazing, every single person we met was kind and went above and beyond. The restaurant staff let my husband get coffee in the morning and did not charge for it. Wilder at the front desk helped my husband find a quiet spot to do a podcast recording after we checked out. They stored our luggage and provided restaurant recommendations. The hotel is right the middle of all the good stuff Hague has to offer. Highly recommend this property for your next stay in Hague

A Vault of Stories Beneath the Surface

This is an amazing spot-aside from the fact that it's a hotel.

What sets it apart isn't just the luxurious rooms or the attentive service, but the layers of history tucked into every corner. Once a grand bank, this building holds more than memories of financial transactions-it houses secrets, legends, and the kind of architectural storytelling that invites you to explore rather than just stay.

Head down the original staircase and you'll find what used to be the vault. It once safeguarded precious items, including the f
golden plates.
Rumor has it that someone went into hiding down there, and that secret holidays-private meetings or celebrations of forbidden ideas-were once held within these stone walls. The air is still thick with echoes.

This place doesn't just whisper its history; it breathes it. The building even inspired the setting for a popular series, and it's easy to see why. With its moody lighting, dramatic architecture, and sense of concealed grandeur, every hallway feels like the opening scene of something cinematic.

Stay for the comfort, yes-but linger for the story. It's a hotel now, but it remains a vault of tales.

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the charming town of Voorburg, Relais & Chateaux - Central Park offers a sophisticated retreat that seamlessly blends elegance with comfort. The understated rooms and suites provide a serene atmosphere, while the upscale restaurant is a culinary gem. Guests can indulge in an array of delectable options, from fresh ceviche to exquisite tarbot paired with green asparagus, all customizable to create a memorable four-course dining experience.

sources.snippet: A boutique hotel surrounded by lush parklands in the heart of Voorburg. Guests step inside to elegant, modern decor oozing historic charm featuring exposed beams and chic wallpaper. With iconic cuisine, luxurious rooms, and beautiful gardens, it's the perfect blend of sophistication and comfort.
sources.shortName: Best places to stay in The Hague, The Netherlands (2025)

places.name: Relais & Chateaux - Central Park Voorburg

reviews.text:
Very good food and service, certainly worth two! Michelin stars.
Beautiful location.

I have no idea about the rooms, I went there for dinner 18-01-2025, solo.

What more can I say?

True Perfection

True perfection of service in a hotel or a restaurant only exists when imperfections are exposed and the staff adapt. It's nobody's fault, but the staff apologise. Not in a servile way, but because they put themselves in your shoes.

The restaurant is exceptional. Old fashioned service and classic French cuisine with the right amount of updates. Deep, eclectic and well-planned cellar. Engaged staff.

The rooms are a little down at heel. But the people who work here, as well as the owner, who's present and hard at work, know that the key to good service is good intentions. This is worth more that fifty flower bouquets.

Speaking of which, the flowers in the hotel are stunning. Overall I love this place and I can't wait to come back.

But even better was the food. The chef made the best Hollandaise Sauce I had ever tasted.

phenomenal cuisine, beautiful interiors (and surroundings) and excellent service - I organized a wedding dinner in the restaurant and I know that it was the best choice. I couldn't have dreamed of a better day - I thank all the staff for contact and support on this important day. and I will definitely come back here more than once just for the food (and wine selection). I recommend it to everyone!

places.generalDescription: Caf√© Bartine is a delightful European-style cafe with two locations in The Hague. Known for its cozy and inviting atmosphere, it offers a range of delicious pastries, brunch options, and high-quality coffee. The cafe takes pride in using homemade ingredients and is especially famous for its Turkish eggs, croissants, and cappuccinos.

sources.snippet: In the heart of the shopping area, Bartine is a great place for lunch. The Middle Eastern dishes are an explosion of flavours and a feast for the eye. Do not expect the average avocado sandwich here, but invented dishes such as burrata with caramelised fennel and burnt leek.
sources.shortName: 5 of the city's best places for lunch in The Hague

places.name: Caf√© Bartine

reviews.text:
Love this spot! A cozy place with a warm, lively yet comfortable atmosphere. The menu is simple - mainly breakfast or all-day brunch items as well as pastries. But the food quality is good. I ordered the Turkish Eggs and enjoyed them thoroughly.

The coffee could be stronger for my taste but I'm nitpicking. Good, friendly service also. A great place for a quick coffee or casual bite to eat!

The three of us chose this place for breakfast - we'd been wanting to come for a while!

Luckily, we managed to find a table inside, towards the back. However, the interior is small and the tables are quite cramped, so I wouldn't say it's the most comfortable setting. It might be better if you can find a spot outside on a nice day.

One of us ordered the avocado on sourdough, another had the Turkish eggs, and I went for the mushrooms on brioche. Everyone was really happy with their food - everything was truly delicious. The combination of the mushrooms with the butterbean pur√©e and eggs‚Ä¶ absolutely unforgettable. I'll definitely be coming back üòç

Bartine is always a great choice. The best cappuccino, excellent service, a great selection of food, and a casual atmosphere that's perfect for what you're looking for in a brunch. The bread is truly unique. I just wish they had more dishes, as that would mean more chances to try their delicious food. One thing to improve: I'd love the cappuccino to be served hotter, since with cold milk it's just not the same.
